title: How misused modifiers can hurt your writing

multiple-choice.question: What is the main purpose of the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: To discuss the importance of using commas in sentences.

options.label: B
options.text: To explain the different types of modifiers and how to use them correctly.

options.label: C
options.text: To provide examples of ambiguous sentences and how to correct them.

options.label: D
options.text: To introduce the concept of modifiers and their role in sentences.

multiple-choice.question: What is a modifier in a sentence?

options.label: A
options.text: A word that adds emphasis to a sentence.

options.label: B
options.text: A phrase or clause that adds information about other parts of a sentence.

options.label: C
options.text: A punctuation mark that separates clauses in a sentence.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of verb that indicates action in a sentence.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when a modifier is not linked clearly enough to the words it is referring to?
What is a dangling modifier?

options.label: A
options.text: A modifier that is not linked clearly enough to the words it is referring to.

options.label: B
options.text: A modifier that seems unrelated to anything else.

options.label: C
options.text: A modifier that is stuck between two things and could feasibly refer to either.

options.label: D
options.text: A modifier that is clearly linked to the words it is referring to.

multiple-choice.question: How can a dangling modifier be corrected?

options.label: A
options.text: By rephrasing the sentence to make it clearer what the modifying phrase is talking about.

options.label: B
options.text: By removing the modifying phrase from the sentence.

options.label: C
options.text: By adding more information to the sentence to clarify the meaning.

options.label: D
options.text: By using a different type of modifier.

multiple-choice.question: What is a squinting modifier?

options.label: A
options.text: A modifier that is stuck between two things and could feasibly refer to either.

options.label: B
options.text: A modifier that is clearly linked to the words it is referring to.

options.label: C
options.text: A modifier that is not linked clearly enough to the words it is referring to.

options.label: D
options.text: A modifier that is used to add emphasis to a sentence.

multiple-choice.question: How can a squinting modifier be corrected?

options.label: A
options.text: By rephrasing the sentence to make it clearer what the modifying phrase is talking about.

options.label: B
options.text: By removing the modifying phrase from the sentence.

options.label: C
options.text: By adding more information to the sentence to clarify the meaning.

options.label: D
options.text: By using a different type of modifier.

multiple-choice.question: What is the importance of using modifiers correctly in sentences?

options.label: A
options.text: To make the sentence more concise.

options.label: B
options.text: To make the sentence more ambiguous.

options.label: C
options.text: To maintain grammatical law and order.

options.label: D
options.text: To add emphasis to the sentence.

multiple-choice.question: What can happen if modifiers are not used correctly in sentences?
Why is the transcript mainly about?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of using commas in sentences.

options.label: B
options.text: The different types of modifiers and how to use them correctly.

options.label: C
options.text: The role of modifiers in sentences.
